description:
When trying devstack, I found that the latest nova code could not spawn instance using quantum network manager.
The nova version is taking from master branch.
title: nova's VM stuck in build state when using quantum network manager

comments.content:
When trying devstack, I found that the latest nova code could not spawn instance using quantum network manager.
The nova version is taking from master branch.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yapengwu

comments.content: Is this still a problem with E4 or current trunk (soon to be essex-RC1, to be cut tomorrow, 3/13)?  If so, we need some specifics on the configuration and error.  Please include (via pastebin) the output of DevStack's tools/info.sh at a minimum.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dtroyer

comments.content:
It has been solved in E-4. 
Please mark it invalid. Thanks.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yapengwu

comments.content:
Does this still happen with the current devstack installation. I am able to deploy instances using Quantum linuxbridge and OVS plugins.
Please clarify.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~garyk

comments.content: Given the age of this bug, i'm marking as invalid, as tons of stuff has changed since then.  Any issues with master can be filed as a new bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danwent
